meanings.definition: Excessive or abnormal nerve supply to a particular area of the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hyperinnervation symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The hyperinnervation response made the patient jump comically.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperinnervation senses were like having a superpower.
meanings.sent5: The hyperinnervation effect was so intense, it felt like a lightning bolt.

meanings.definition: The state of having an increased number of nerve fibers in a specific region.
meanings.sent1: The hyperinnervation in his arm was causing tingling.
meanings.sent2: The study focused on the hyperinnervation of the spinal cord.
meanings.sent3: The hyperinnervation in the brain made him think faster than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperinnervation of knowledge amazed everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The hyperinnervation of nerve fibers was like a dense forest in his body.

meanings.definition: Overstimulation of nerves leading to heightened sensitivity or pain.
meanings.sent1: The hyperinnervation in her fingertips made typing unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the concept of hyperinnervation to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The hyperinnervation of emotions made her cry at the slightest thing.
meanings.sent4: His hyperinnervation of pain was like a constant electric shock.
meanings.sent5: The hyperinnervation sensation was as sharp as a needle prick.
